ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8-12, the course does not have a classroom component. 100 hours are required for the semester.
This depended on the week, however, I averaged about 8-10hrs per week.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The course itself is fine; but predominance of Hartford internships were logistically difficult to manage
I very much enjoyed my practicum experience and felt it was an engaging and worthwhile experience.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley is excellent to speak with via email;
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley is a great instructor, and for this course, she checked in with our progress a reasonable number of times.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course is fine, though having a pre-determined set of New Haven-based internships would significantly improve the course experience and immersion

This course is a great way to get some experience out of the classroom. The experience will vary based on the placement, but I loved my placement and feel as though I was able to learn a lot from my experience. I would recommend taking this course.
